alert.note: Alert for Lower Kuskokwim Valley (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued May 13 at 12:50PM AKDT by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH FOR AN ICE JAM IN EFFECT THROUGH MONDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by an ice jam is possible. * WHERE...Including the following area, Kuskokwim River including the communities of Crooked Creek and Georgetown. * WHEN...Through Monday morning. * IMPACTS...An ice jam has formed 5 miles downstream of Red Devil on Saturday morning. The jam is causing flooding in the community of Red Devil. As the ice jam moves downstream over the weekend, the communities of Crooked Creek and Georgetown should be ready for ice jam related flooding. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Ice jam flooding has high uncertainty. Impacts could range between localized high water and severe flooding. Now is the time to take precautions. Where possible, move items to higher ground and prepare your community for possible flooding. - Http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.
